ComputeFluence(ForwardSolverType, FluenceSolutionDomainType, IndependentVariableAxis[], double[][], IOpticalPropertyRegion[], params double[])

ComputeFluence overload computes fluence

public static double[] ComputeFluence(ForwardSolverType forwardSolverType, FluenceSolutionDomainType solutionDomainType, IndependentVariableAxis[] independentAxesTypes, double[][] independentValues, IOpticalPropertyRegion[] tissueRegions, params double[] constantValues)

Parameters

forwardSolverType ForwardSolverType

The ForwardSolverType enum (e.g. PointSourceSDA, DistributedPointSourceSDA, etc.)

solutionDomainType FluenceSolutionDomainType

The FluenceSolutionDomainType enum (e.g. FluenceOfRhoAndZ, FluenceOfFxAndZ etc.)

independentAxesTypes IndependentVariableAxis[]

The array of IndependentVariableAxis enum (Rho, Time, Fx, Ft, Z)

independentValues double[][]

The jagged array of independent values

tissueRegions IOpticalPropertyRegion[]

The array of optical property regions

constantValues double[]

The double array of variable length with the constant values

Returns

double[]

A double[] of resulting linearized fluence values

ComputeFluence(ForwardSolverType, FluenceSolutionDomainType, IndependentVariableAxis[], double[][], OpticalProperties, params double[])

ComputeFluence overload determines fluence which uses the first parameter ForwardSolverType to determine appropriate IForwardSolver and then calls overload. This overload also has a single set of OpticalProperties parameter rather than an array.

public static double[] ComputeFluence(ForwardSolverType forwardSolverType, FluenceSolutionDomainType solutionDomainType, IndependentVariableAxis[] independentAxesTypes, double[][] independentValues, OpticalProperties opticalProperties, params double[] constantValues)

Parameters

forwardSolverType ForwardSolverType

The ForwardSolverType enum (e.g. PointSourceSDA, DistributedPointSourceSDA, etc.)

solutionDomainType FluenceSolutionDomainType

The FluenceSolutionDomainType enum (e.g. FluenceOfRhoAndZ, FluenceOfFxAndZ etc.)

independentAxesTypes IndependentVariableAxis[]

The IndependentVariableAxis enum (Rho, Time, Fx, Ft, Z)

independentValues double[][]

The double array of independent axis type values

opticalProperties OpticalProperties

The single set of optical properties

constantValues double[]

The double array of variable length with the constant values

Returns

double[]

A double[] of resulting reflectance values

ComputeFluence(ForwardSolverType, FluenceSolutionDomainType, IndependentVariableAxis[], double[][], OpticalProperties[], params double[])

ComputeFluence determines fluence. It uses the first parameter forwardSolverType to determine appropriate IForwardSolver and then calls the method overload with that value.

public static double[] ComputeFluence(ForwardSolverType forwardSolverType, FluenceSolutionDomainType solutionDomainType, IndependentVariableAxis[] independentAxesTypes, double[][] independentValues, OpticalProperties[] opticalProperties, params double[] constantValues)

Parameters

The SolutionDomainType enum (e.g. RofRho, RofRx, etc.)

The IndependentVariableAxis enum (Rho, Time, Fx, Ft, Z)

independentValues double[][]

The double array of independent type axis values

opticalProperties OpticalProperties[]

The array of optical properties

Returns

ComputeFluence(IForwardSolver, FluenceSolutionDomainType, IndependentVariableAxis[], double[][], IOpticalPropertyRegion[], params double[])

ComputeFluence overload determines fluence given the input parameters.

public static double[] ComputeFluence(IForwardSolver forwardSolver, FluenceSolutionDomainType solutionDomainType, IndependentVariableAxis[] independentAxesTypes, double[][] independentValues, IOpticalPropertyRegion[] tissueRegions, params double[] constantValues)

Parameters

forwardSolver IForwardSolver

The forward solver class

solutionDomainType FluenceSolutionDomainType

The FluenceSolutionDomainType enum (e.g. FluenceOfRhoAndZ, FluenceOfFxAndZ etc.)

independentAxesTypes IndependentVariableAxis[]

The array of IndependentVariableAxis enum (Rho, Time, Fx, Ft, Z)

independentValues double[][]

The double array of independent type axis values

tissueRegions IOpticalPropertyRegion[]

The array of IOpticalPropertyRegion which allows for multi-region tissue

constantValues double[]

The double array of variable length with the constant values

Returns

double[]

A double[] of resulting linearized fluence value

ComputeReflectance(ForwardSolverType, SolutionDomainType, ForwardAnalysisType, object[])

ComputeReflectance determines reflectance. It uses the first parameter forwardSolverType to determine appropriate IForwardSolver and then calls the method overload with that value.

public static double[] ComputeReflectance(ForwardSolverType forwardSolverType, SolutionDomainType solutionDomainType, ForwardAnalysisType forwardAnalysisType, object[] independentValues)

Parameters

forwardSolverType ForwardSolverType

The ForwardSolverType enum (e.g. PointSourceSDA, DistributedPointSourceSDA, etc.)

solutionDomainType SolutionDomainType

The SolutionDomainType enum (e.g. RofRho, RofRx, etc.)

forwardAnalysisType ForwardAnalysisType

The ForwardAnalysisType enum (e.g. R, dRdMua, dRdMusp, etc.)

independentValues object[]

The array of objects: first element = OpticalProperties, second element = double[] of x-axis values, for example: new object[]{ new[]{ new OpticalProperties(0.01, 1, 0.8, 1.4) }, new double[] { 1, 2, 3 } })

Returns

double[]

A double[] of resulting reflectance values

ComputeReflectance(IForwardSolver, SolutionDomainType, ForwardAnalysisType, object[])

ComputeReflectance overload determines reflectance. It uses the first parameter IForwardSolver instead of ForwardSolverType.

public static double[] ComputeReflectance(IForwardSolver forwardSolver, SolutionDomainType solutionDomainType, ForwardAnalysisType forwardAnalysisType, object[] independentValues)

Parameters

forwardSolver IForwardSolver

The forward solver class

solutionDomainType SolutionDomainType

The SolutionDomainType enum (e.g. RofRho, RofRx, etc.)

forwardAnalysisType ForwardAnalysisType

The ForwardAnalysisType enum (e.g. R, dRdMua, dRdMusp, etc.)

independentValues object[]

The array of objects: first element = OpticalProperties, second element = double[] of x-axis values, for example: new object[]{ new[]{ new OpticalProperties(0.01, 1, 0.8, 1.4) }, new double[] { 1, 2, 3 } })

Returns

double[]

A double[] of resulting reflectance values

GetAbsorbedEnergy(IEnumerable<double>, IEnumerable<double>)

Method to generate absorbed energy given fluence and mua for heterogeneous tissue.

public static IEnumerable<double> GetAbsorbedEnergy(IEnumerable<double> fluence, IEnumerable<double> muas)

Parameters

fluence IEnumerable<double>

The fluence serialized to a 1D IEnumerable

muas IEnumerable<double>

The absorption coefficient serialized to a 1D IEnumerable with Count equal to that of fluence

Returns

IEnumerable<double>

Absorbed energy in a 1D IEnumerable of double

GetAbsorbedEnergy(IEnumerable<double>, double)

Method to generate absorbed energy given fluence and mua. Note only works for homogeneous tissue.

Parameters

fluence IEnumerable<double>

The fluence serialized to a 1D IEnumerable of double

mua double

The absorption coefficient for entire tissue

Returns

IEnumerable<double>

Absorbed energy in a 1D IEnumerable of double

GetPHD(ForwardSolverType, double[], double, OpticalProperties[], double[], double[])

Overload of GetPHD that uses internal DI framework-supplied solver singletons

public static double[] GetPHD(ForwardSolverType forwardSolverType, double[] fluence, double sdSeparation, OpticalProperties[] ops, double[] rhos, double[] zs)

Parameters

forwardSolverType ForwardSolverType

The ForwardSolverType enum (e.g. PointSourceSDA, DistributedPointSourceSDA, etc.)

fluence double[]

The linearized fluence to be used to generate PHD, column major

sdSeparation double

The source detector separation (in mm)

ops OpticalProperties[]

The optical properties

rhos double[]

The detector locations (in mm)

zs double[]

The z values (in mm)

Returns

double[]

A double[] of resulting linearized PHD values

GetPHD(ForwardSolverType, Complex[], double, double, OpticalProperties[], double[], double[])

Overload of GetPHD that uses internal DI framework-supplied solver singletons

public static double[] GetPHD(ForwardSolverType forwardSolverType, Complex[] fluence, double sdSeparation, double timeModulationFrequency, OpticalProperties[] ops, double[] rhos, double[] zs)

Parameters

forwardSolverType ForwardSolverType

The ForwardSolverType enum (e.g. PointSourceSDA, DistributedPointSourceSDA, etc.)

fluence Complex[]

The linearized fluence used to generate PHD, column major

sdSeparation double

The source detector separation (in mm)

timeModulationFrequency double

The modulation frequency of Time-Domain fluence

ops OpticalProperties[]

The optical properties

rhos double[]

The detector locations (in mm)

zs double[]

The z values (in mm)

Returns

double[]

A double array o photon hitting density map

SolveInverse(ForwardSolverType, OptimizerType, SolutionDomainType, double[], double[], InverseFitType, object[])

Method to provide the inverse solution.

public static double[] SolveInverse(ForwardSolverType forwardSolverType, OptimizerType optimizerType, SolutionDomainType solutionDomainType, double[] dependentValues, double[] standardDeviationValues, InverseFitType inverseFitType, object[] independentValues)

Parameters

forwardSolverType ForwardSolverType

The ForwardSolverType enum (e.g. PointSourceSDA, DistributedPointSourceSDA, etc.)

optimizerType OptimizerType

The OptimizerType enum (e.g. MPFitLevenbergMarquardt)

solutionDomainType SolutionDomainType

The SolutionDomainType enum (e.g. ROfRho, ROfFx)

dependentValues double[]

The measured data length = x axis variable count

standardDeviationValues double[]

The standard deviation of measured data

inverseFitType InverseFitType

The InverseFitType enum (e.g. Mua, Musp, MuaMusp, MuaMuspG)

independentValues object[]

The array of objects: first element = OpticalProperties, second element = double[] of x axis values, for example: new object[]{ new[]{ new OpticalProperties(0.01, 1, 0.8, 1.4) }, new double[] { 1, 2, 3 } })

Returns

double[]

A double array of optical property inverse solution

SolveInverse(ForwardSolverType, OptimizerType, SolutionDomainType, double[], double[], InverseFitType, object[], double[], double[])

Method to provide the inverse solution.

public static double[] SolveInverse(ForwardSolverType forwardSolverType, OptimizerType optimizerType, SolutionDomainType solutionDomainType, double[] dependentValues, double[] standardDeviationValues, InverseFitType inverseFitType, object[] independentValues, double[] lowerBounds, double[] upperBounds)

Parameters

forwardSolverType ForwardSolverType

The ForwardSolverType enum (e.g. PointSourceSDA, DistributedPointSourceSDA, etc.)

optimizerType OptimizerType

The OptimizerType enum (e.g. MPFitLevenbergMarguardt

solutionDomainType SolutionDomainType

The SolutionDomainType enum (e.g. ROfRho, ROfFx)

dependentValues double[]

The measured data length = x axis variable count

standardDeviationValues double[]

The standard deviation of measured data

inverseFitType InverseFitType

The InverseFitType enum (e.g. Mua, Musp, MuaMusp, MuaMuspG)

independentValues object[]

The array of objects: first element = OpticalProperties, second element = double[] of x axis values, for example: new object[]{ new[]{ new OpticalProperties(0.01, 1, 0.8, 1.4) }, new double[] { 1, 2, 3 } })

lowerBounds double[]

constrained fit with lower bounds for OPs, size = 4 for all OPs

upperBounds double[]

constrained fit with upper bounds for OPs, size = 4 for all OPs

Returns

double[]

A double array of optical property inverse solution

SolveInverse(IForwardSolver, IOptimizer, SolutionDomainType, double[], double[], InverseFitType, object[])

Method to provide the inverse solution.

dependentValues double[]

The measured data length = x axis variable count

standardDeviationValues double[]

The standard deviation of measured data

inverseFitType InverseFitType

The InverseFitType enum (e.g. Mua, Musp, MuaMusp, MuaMuspG)

independentValues object[]

The array of objects: first element = OpticalProperties, second element = double[] of x axis values, for example: new object[]{ new[]{ new OpticalProperties(0.01, 1, 0.8, 1.4) }, new double[] { 1, 2, 3 } })

SolveInverse(IForwardSolver, IOptimizer, SolutionDomainType, double[], double[], InverseFitType, object[], double[], double[])

Method to provide the inverse solution.

public static double[] SolveInverse(IForwardSolver forwardSolver, IOptimizer optimizer, SolutionDomainType solutionDomainType, double[] dependentValues, double[] standardDeviationValues, InverseFitType inverseFitType, object[] independentValues, double[] lowerBounds, double[] upperBounds)

Parameters

forwardSolver IForwardSolver

The forward solver class

optimizer IOptimizer

The optimizer class

solutionDomainType SolutionDomainType

The SolutionDomainType enum (e.g. ROfRho, ROfFx)

dependentValues double[]

The measured data length = x axis variable count

standardDeviationValues double[]

The standard deviation of measured data

inverseFitType InverseFitType

The InverseFitType enum (e.g. Mua, Musp, MuaMusp, MuaMuspG)

independentValues object[]

The array of objects: first element = OpticalProperties, second element = double[] of xaxis values, for example: new object[]{ new[]{ new OpticalProperties(0.01, 1, 0.8, 1.4) }, new double[] { 1, 2, 3 } })

lowerBounds double[]

The constrained fit with lower bounds for OPs, size = 4 for all OPs

upperBounds double[]

The constrained fit with upper bounds for OPs, size = 4 for all OPs

Returns

double[]

A double array of optical property inverse solution
